creator: amanda.sinton@coranta.com
text:
When passing the name of a JSP file to a servlet as path information, an 
attempt is made to find the JSP under the path /app/servlet/Servlet/file.jsp, 
resulting in a 404 error. When the name of an HTML file is provided (i.e the 
URL is /app/servlet/Servlet/file.html), the behaviour is as expected; i.e. the 
servlet is called and the file can be obtained as path information.

Things worked OK with /file.jsp as path info in Tomcat 3.1.

That's because the mapper found a match ( using extension mapping ). 
/servlet behavior is undefined in the spec, and currently is implemented 
after normal mapping takes place. 
The right fix for you is to declare the servlet in web.xml. The impl should
also be fixed, not difficult but low priority.

text:
This bug will probably not be closed for 3.3

The right solution is to declare the servlet in web.xml, /servlet is 
just a hack.
